column4: 777 River City Casino Boulevard St. Louis, MO  63125
column13: We had a party of four and we all thought the food was prepared exactly as ordered. The portions are large enough to split and the wait staff is very attentive. My wife and I have eaten here numerous times but for us it's a little on the expensive side so we come here for special occasions, but it is always well worth the cost. We highly recommend this restaurant.

column4: 3910 Peachtreee Dr. Suite H Columbia, MO  65203
column13: The staff was amazing here. The day we went someone called from the restaurant to ask if there was anything special that they could do since we were having a bridal shower. We decided to put the brides bill on mine and to have her dessert brought out before everyone else without her even seeing a menu. When we got there 45 minutes before our reserved time, they seated us right away in a large comfy booth on a raised platform overlooking the rest of the dining a bar area, so we felt a bit special. The waitress was very prompt and kept checking on us for about an hour while we waited for the last person in our party. We ordered the welsh rarebit for the table and it was amazing. The 44 stone burger was delicious as well. Recommend!!!
My favorite restaurant in St. Louis.
Quick business lunch on the outside patio. Food was good (grouper), well prepared, and timely.

For those of us who love the cuisine of other Eastern Mediterranean cultures, such as Lebanese or Greek fare, Aya Sofia's Turkish theme is at once both familiar and adventurous. We love the nuanced seasonings, great vegetarian options and flavorful lamb dishes. They are also our favorite source for a calamari appetizer.
Food was excellent and wait staff was very helpful and friendly.

The food is excellent!! It is a very busy place and the noise is overwhelming if your trying to have a conversation. Though I would go back everyday of the week because of the food. The wine we enjoyed Tres Picos was good and our server was accommodating.

column4: 1130 Town and Country Crossing Dr Town and Country, MO  63017
column13: I had the Autumn risotto, which was super. Also had the duck confit salad. Great. Others had the curry, a steak, steak tartare, veggie Napoleon. All excellent.

Bixby's is one of the few restaurants in St. Louis that specialize in civilized dining: good food, a peaceful setting, and the opportunity to converse without having to shout over loud music. The menu is creative -- and the prices are reasonable. The service is exceptional -- friendly, hospitable, and attentive without being overbearing. This is a five-star eating experience.
Four of us attended before attending the show at Jesse Hall. The dining experience was a delight!

column4: 1034 S. Brentwood Blvd. Saint Louis, MO  63117
column13: My wife and I chose to eat here after reading some of the other reviews. The martinis were great. They have 60 "flavors" of martinis on the menu and we sampled 4 that were very tasty. We chose to try several appetizers because they were only $5 during happy hour and the chicken lollipop skewers were awesome. We also tried the Popeye pizza(spinach, olive paste, feta cheese) and it was good. Since we were headed to a concert, we did eat pretty early (5:00) and the resturant was empty. We are headed back in a couple weeks with some friends to sample more martinis. Overall it was a great experience!

wE HAD OUR FAMILY REUNION AT THE BOATHOUSE. IT WAS A MEMORIAL TIME. THE MENUE CHOICES PLEASED ALL THE FOODIES IN THE FAMILY ALSO THE FINICKY PALET OF THE LITTLE ONES. AFTER DINNER AND DESSERT THE KIDS WENT OUTSIDE TO FEED THE DUCKS AND GO FOR A PADDLEBOAT RIDE ON THE BEAUTIFUL LAKE. THE WHOLE FAMILY FELL IN LOVE WITH THE BOATHOUSE.
Our waitress was very helpful when ordering our dinner. The food was delicious.

An eclectic place with an interesting Cuban/caribbean focus. I had ropa vieja with cuban rice, a really good and different dish. Definitely not a dress up place. The wine list is notable only for poor selections (Blackstone Merlot, Ravenswood Cab?)and high prices.
A true french restaurant (blanquette de veau, cassoulet, profiteroles, floating islands, etc.) We will go back!
The Twilight menu is a good way to try out Bristol if you've never been there. Three courses for 19.50 cannot be beat.

Excellent upscale restaurant with surf and turf type dishes. Wine list was nice. Get on their email list and get birthday discounts. Some of their well known dishes include scallops, Lobster and Macaroni, steaks and Carrot Cake to top it off.

The food was delicious and well prepared. I thought maybe $16 for a six shrimp cocktail appetizer was a little pricy but they were done perfectly so I quickly forgot about the price. The service, overall was very good. The only negative on this review is that I gave my parking stub to the waitress to be validated. She forgot about it (and so did I) until after I had left the restaurant to go to a movie and had to rush back and find her to get it. Just a little detail but also an inconvenience. Other than that, all aces.

Everything was GREAT at Cafe Napoli...!!!Table was waiting for us when we arrived.Quinton was our waiter. He was professional, friendly and prompt...Q was great!It was my wife's Birthday and he chose our desert and it was on the house!!I had Veal Parmesan and my wife had Chicken Pasta...wonderful!!!Our server was Mayra, she was also a true professional and very friendly. Both Q and Myra took care of our every needs.We will be back at Cafe Napoli.

Wonderful entertainment and very good food. Nice choice of Italian dishes. The veal was fork tender and a generous portion. Shrimp and scallops had a strange spice, but were good. Nice overall experience.
Had not been there in a long time. I am in my mid 30s and felt like the youngest person in the place. The clientele was old!

column4: 777 Casino Center Drive Harrah's Casino Maryland Heights, MO  63043
column13: I just wish the tables for two people were bigger. They seem cramped.

column1: Charlie Gitto's from the Hill - Chesterfield
column13: This Charlie Gittos doesn't compare to the one in the Harrahs Casino. The food doesn't match the mood setting nor. The price. Me and my husband ordered the chicken nunzio which is excellenat the the Harrahs and suppose to be one of there signature dishes at this location as well; the chicken and potatoes tasted like frozen food I can buy at the grocery store, it was room temperature although the plates were piping hot. It was almost like they plated frozen food , put it in the oven and then put sauce over the top of it. The sauce was the only thing that tasted decent. Would not recommend anyone eating here especially for the price. Go to the Harrahs location instead; we've never been to the one on The Hill so not sure about that one.
Walk into a time capsule with excellent service that seems to be a thing of the past at most restaurants. The maitre d' sets the tone and it just gets better.

column4: 999 N Second Street St. Louis, MO  63102
column13: i have been there multiple times and it has always been extremely nice. this time however i was totally disappointed;the pizza was just ok, the service was lackluster, and the noise level was very loud. glad it was just a buddy and not a date with me. i know they can do better.

After having made a reservation well in advance, I was given the worst table in the house, with very little concern from management.Service was slow.Food took forever to come up.The fried clams, one of the specials, were as tough as my left shoe.NOT a wonderful evening.
We had our 1 year old with us and the server went above and beyond to.make our baby feel at home

A tasty little secret in Clayton, MO. This is a cozy, dark wood themed French restaurant in an unassuming storefront. The looks belie the incredibly tasty menu and wine list, and their commitment to local, seasonal foods and wine. The tasting menu is a bargain for the quality and diversity of dining choices, and is highly recommended. The local grass fed tenderloin was excellent, as were the scallops. The staff is friendly and attentive without being pushy or intrusive. The atmosphere is quiet. This is an excellent choice for a romantic dinner for 2, or for an evening of good food and conversation among friends. A real value price wise.
Amazing food, great drinks, the best mexican restaurant in St. Louis by far.

column4: 323 West Port Plaza Maryland Heights, MO  63146
column13: Dierdorf & Hart's has been consistent for all of our visits. The food is always top notch and the service is second to none. We have lived in St. Louis for 7 years and Dierdof & Hart's is our favorite steak and fine dining destination.

Dominics is a beautfil italian restaurant on the hill. We went for our 7th anniversary. The only concern we had was the portion size, especially for the amount of money we spent. The food was very flavorful but not enough to fill you up. Make sure to order an appetizer before the main dish.
Wonderful business lunch location.

Arrived 10 minutes late because of traffic. No problem with reservation and seated immediately. Sushi was outstanding and service from Deon was top notch. Prices are competitive on regular basis. Happy hour menu is a terrific bargain with many items 50% off. All items were deivered timely with appropriate follow-up. Great sishi experience.
To people making reservations beware that you will not have access to the happy hour menu for drinks or food. That said the rolls were worth paying full price for the drinks were not.

column4: 639 Westport Plaza Drive Saint Louis, MO  63146
column13: Sushi was good and the atmosphere was good as well.
overrated, the price is not worthy of the food, although the food is good.

column4: 6177 Delmar Blvd in The Loop St. Louis, MO  63112
column13: Good food though the menu is limited. Good selection of wine and beer, though the by-the-glass-wine selections were also limited. Service was slow.

I was visiting St. Louis to have a "sisters" weekend and we needed to plan ahead for one of our dinners. All 4 of us are from different states so no one knew about good restaurants in the area. Open Table is my favorite phone AP and it helped me find the EdgeWild Restaurant and Winery in Chesterfield. What a great place! The food was spectacular. The servers were friendly and the wine tasting option was so much fun! Even the owner came to our table to make sure we were having a good time. They even ship their wine so I'm anxious to receive my two bottles and enjoy them here in Denver.
What more can we say? Eleven Eleven once again provided an outstanding evening of food and atmosphere for us. Rabbit was delicious; beef was well cooked. Soups were tasty. Dessert great.

We enjoyed the 4 course option - very reasonable at $45 per person. Serving sizes were just right, the quality and flavor was wonderful. The only disappointment was the salmon; overcooked and lacking in seasoning.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - St. Louis
column4: 1855 S Lindbergh Blvd. Saint Louis, MO  63131
column13: As always the service was exemplary. We had the double chicken breast and a fillet, both were cooked perfectly. The wine tablet (ipad) shows an amazing array of choices. This is an ideal venue for a special occasion.
Very well prepared and creative food!
The food and lighting are great. The tile floor leads to noisy and service could be more attentive.

column4: 701 Market Street Suite 100 Saint Louis, MO  63101
column13: These guys were very accommodating for our large group with children. The food was great and reasonably priced.
We had to cancel - will reschedule in Dec.
Everything was great and Ermin was wonderful !

column4: 1059 South Big Bend Blvd. St. Louis, MO  63117
column13: Loved the food, great chef, love the layers of flavors throughout the dish...true cuisine...timing between courses perfect...

column4: 1200 S. Main St. Saint Charles, MO  63301
column13: I loved Hendricks. The decor was great and we really felt like we were at a rustic smokehouse. The food was great with many selections. We had The Whole Shebang. Which is a sample of all their BBQ meats with 4 sides. I found the BBQ and sauces very very good. The bar and drink list was different and fun. The lighting was good and there were TV's up by the bar that can be seen throughout the place so we got to watch the Cardinal game while we ate. It wasn't too loud and we also thought the seating was comfortable.
If you are older than 25 you will feel very old in this restaurant. All of the other diners were evidently Wash U students, mainly undergraduates, at least when we were there, a Friday night.
The service was excellent and the menu was great great. There was a lot of variety and something for everyone.

column1: J. Gilbert’s Wood-Fired Steaks & Seafood - West County Center
column4: 17A West County Center Suite A102 Des Peres, MO  63131
column13: I entertained customers. We all thoroughly enjoyed everything from drinks, wine, appetizers, through to desert. We all ordered different things and everything was great.

The food was very good but the service was only average. Most of our drinks (like a martini) came without garnishs which we were very surprised by. We were in a separate room but it was very noisy and really not a quiet experience like we had hoped. It was just not a great experience - only average and we won't return since it was only average but priced like it should have been better than that!

column4: 522 N. Grand Ave St. Louis, MO  63103
column13: Nice to have a great restaurant on Grand Ave. Food was very good and they easily accommodated requests. Just wish the menu was bigger.

column4: 535 South Lindbergh Blvd St. Louis, MO  63131
column13: Another excellent experience at this restaurant. Best steaks in St Louis. Not a place for a quiet dinner. Always packed, but service is excellent. Always go back for a great dinner.

Good food and attentive service -- it's great to have a restaurant like this in the Grove. They make some pretty tasty hummus. Our party of eight wasn't sure about the belly dancer at first, but she turned out to have a great sense of humor and made this place really memorable. The kitchen might want to have a look at its baklava recipe, though. Light and flaky on the pastry is what's called for, guys.

This meal was outstanding. The wine pairings were especially superb. The sommelier and chef really understand the art of great food and great wine. The chef uses molecular gastronomy wisely and sparingly to enhance dishes. For example, creating pine nut dust that somehow melts in your mouth into a velvety consistency.

column4: 1330 Washington Ave 500 N 14th Street Saint Louis, MO  63103
column13: Go for the music and the atmosphere. Snack but dont dine
Great place for a nice quiet inner in a neighborhood restaurant.
Wonderful meal. Quality and temperature of food was perfect.Best meal/dining experience I've had in a while

My husband and I had dinner with another couple here for my birthday. Good ambiance, a bit noisy but wasn't a distraction...it did seem a bit crowded as we were seated right by the pizza oven. The food was delicious - Toasted Ravioli of the Day was ricotta/red pepper and could definitely tell it was homemade. Pear Salad, Swallow's Nest, Pork Ragu and Scorze pasta were all unique and delicious. Pumpkin pudding with salted caramel whipped cream for dessert - perfect!

column4: #2 The Boulevard St. Louis Richmond Heights, MO  63117
column13: Wonderful as always! However we did complain about our cheesecake and the waiter did nothing about it. Disappointing.

First trip, as wonderful as expected. Everything was flavorful. Peruvian cuisine is not Mexican food, more Mediterranean in nature but with nice use of Peruvian peppers and seasoning combinations. Deft touch with sea scallops which is always a good test for a kitchen. My partner had grilled shrimp with a bowtie pasta that was fantastic, superbly seasoned. The national dessert, a spongecake like roll with a caramel sauce inside, is positively addicting. We will definitely be back.

column4: 17 West County Center Des Peres, MO  63131
column13: We were there early in the evening-on a Sunday- so there were lots of families there. Very nice ambiance- everyone working there seemed genuinely happy to be there. The food was fantastic- overall it was a great experience! Will definitely go back.

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal.We appreciated that the restaurant owner was seating people and spoke to us a few times throughout our meal.The servers are extremely friendly and take care of you very well.The food was delicious!

When you have to almost beg to get the water glass filled, you know you are in for a long dinner out. I don't know if our server got slammed with tables all at once or what, but our party of two seemed very low on his list. After taking our order, he then returned to say they might be out of what I had ordered, did I have a second choice. Then left. My husband asked which entree I thought I might be getting - we were left in suspense. While the food was good, it didn't match my expectation level for the place and its prices. Just goes to show that service makes all the difference (or at least a significant amount of difference).

column4: 20 Allen Ave Suite 130 Webster Groves, MO  63119
column13: One of the best meals I've had in St. Louis. I'll definitely be coming back!

Modesto has everything going for it (great look, super service fresh locally sourced food), but they have to improve on the taste of their food. Cauliflower cooked in truffle should have at least a hint of that glourious truffle taste. The same goes for paella. I could not detect saffron and the dish while fresh and hot had little to no taste. I will definitly give Modesto another chance due to their great service, super ambiance and overall potential.

column1: Morton's The Steakhouse - St. Louis - Clayton
column13: This was our first time at Morton's and it was very delightful evening. The service and food were oustanding.

Had an excellent dining experience on a busy Saturday night. The manager Shaun greeted us at the door. Mosaic's was energized and the kitchen was sending beautiful food at a great pace. Service was friendly and attentive without being intrusive. The soup sampler appetizer was a great way to try 3 different soups in proportionate serving sizes The butternut squash was so flavorful. A real interesting and special entree was the Roasted Bone Marrow; split bones with the richest, creamiest marrow to be spread on the accompanying bread. So Good!! The Missouri Organic Tenderloin was so tender and had a nice flavor. Presentation of all the food was enticing. I will be back and will highly recommend Mosaic's.
Food was great and service was exceptional!

column4: 500 South Main St St. Charles, MO  63301
column13: I have been to this restaurant before and the service and food were excellant. When our group went this time the food was sub-standard, the celery salad dressing tasted and looked as though it had been watered down. The service was terrible. We had made reservations well in advance and we waited for approximately 30 minutes before our orders were taken. The young man said that he was trying to take care of 4 tables. We had reservations for the evening meal also but I cancelled them because of this poor service. I doubt that I will go back there again.

column4: 1054 Town & Country Crossing Town and Country, MO  63017
column13: The evening was perfect! Our server was pleasant and knowledgeable. He was attentive, but not overly involved. We had many different servings and they were all appropriately paced. The food was served in a timely manner and was exceptional.

We were dining at Niche for the first time, meeting our friend's new boyfriend. The food was excellent (terrific, amazing, original). The menu itself was a great conversation starter! Everything tasted fresh and delicious. Recommendations from our waitress were spot-on. Am definitely recommending Niche to friends and family for a special occassion or "just because."

The menu is very creative and the food is subtly, and complexly flavored. Highly recommend for a new and innovative dining experience. Portions are substantial, you will feel well fed after your meal. Very attentive wait staff.
Food and service was very good.

Porterhouse steak was outstanding, very flavorful. Service was very good, never had to ask for anything. Salad was huge, could maybe downsize it a little bit, but not a big deal there. The bread pudding also very good for dessert. Would definitely recommend this place for special occassions or just a night for a great steak.

I will definately return to Prime 1000 and will recommend them. The ambiance is what you'd expect at an upscale, fine-dining restaurant but without being snobby or elitest, very comfortable. The decor has a nice modern feel, with interesting original art in the bar and dining room. While the side-dishes were very good, they weren't outstanding and the real "star-of-the-show" is, of course, the steak, which is extraordinary.

column4: 227 W. Lockwood Ave. Webster Groves, MO  63119
column13: They have successfully combined dining with more formal wine tasting. Once you've found something you like, you can purchase their wines in their wine shop to take home.
GREAT FOOD,MORE OF A HOT SPOT BAR SCENE ENVIROMENT. i WOULD GO BACK AGAIN.
Great Food- Fast Service- Enjoyed the Cardinals Play Off Game while enjoying great drinks and food- a total home run!!!
Terrific quality food and spectacular service. Dining room is dated but still attractive in an old fashioned sense.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - St. Louis
column13: We ate at the location in downtown St. Louis. It was a great experience. My 13 year old son took me, his mother out on his first date. It was such a wonderful occasion and we truly enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. My son stated the next day "that the steak was really good". Our waitress was nice and pleasant. We also got the opportunity to meet Charles Woodson of the Green Bay Packers. My son took a picture with him so he thought the experience was superb. I would recommend eating at this restaurant.

My husband and I are regulars at Sanctuaria and it never disappoints. We always take our out of town guests here and they love it. The atmosphere is great and the food is outstanding. It's so nice to be able to order so many different plates to share since everything is so delicious it is nice to sample a variety of things. The service is always great as well. It's great food without the fuss. The cocktails are also excellent. I'm never sure what I want and upon answering a few questions, they create a drink for me that is delicious! We highly recommend it!
Awesome food, atmosphere, & fun.Can't wait to return!

column4: 6-8 S. Sarah St. Saint Louis, MO  63108
column13: Overall a very positive dining experience. Had to send the flank steak back being a bit underdone for Medium but the end result was delicious. Service was good for the most part and the ambiance very amenable to quiet conversation. Was my first visit and plan on lunch there in the near future.

column4: 3024 S Grand Blvd St. Louis, MO  63118
column13: We had a great time, but the company we were with helped with that. I was a little disappointed our waitress didn't seem to be able to do more than one thing at a time. We she asked for our drink orders, she did it one at a time. It seemed odd to us. The food was exceptional. We love sushi, and we did try new things and it was delicious! The server was not real attentive to us, leaving us be after drinks, and then waiting for our food, seemed to take longer than normal. It was our first visit at this restaurant, so not the best first impression. I try not to be too picky, realizing servers sometimes have 'off' days, but it could have been better. Food was fantastic though!
Everything was great. Thank you.

Normally, this is a great place to go on a Saturday night. But this past Saturday, the wait staff was uninterested and scatter brained when seating us, taking orders and serving us. Then there were at a rush to get us out the door. I guess I could accept that if their was a line waiting, but their were tables open. Prior to the live music , the overhead music was also too low for any ambiance or atmosphere to be created. It was almost odd how silent the room felt. The live musician did make things better, but that was close to 8:00.

column4: 308 N. Euclid Ave. St. Louis, MO  63108
column13: I always enjoy myself at Sub Zero. I started going for the drinks and now I go for the food as well! I went to celebrate a friend's birthday and was told upon my reservation confirmation that there is a charge, per person, to bring in your own dessert. Keep that in mind before you spend money on a nice cake or cupcakes.

We ate at Table Three for our 36 anniversary. We were seated in a private room which was very nice. Great service. Food was delicious. A few problems, food could have been hotter but taste for most items we ordered was great. Will recommend and will go back.

column4: 2961 Dougherty Ferry Rd. Suite 101 Saint Louis, MO  63122
column13: Another evening with great food, excellent service and fun atmosphere. We love The Tavern. We celebrated our 30 yr olds birthday. He is a Chicago resident and Tavern rates right there with the Top Chicago restaurants he frequents!

I am in the restaurant business and appreciate a staff that strives to serve well and pay attention to detail. One of the things I look for is how the staff attends the table and these guys had the drinks full and were very efficient. They were attentive without being invasive. Good experience. It was early on a Sunday afternoon and that can sometimes be an inconsistent meal.
Still the best! They know how to do it so well!

column4: 132 N Main St Saint Charles, MO  63301
column13: New to town. First time there. Excellent experience. Would go back.

column1: Top of the Riverfront - Millennium Hotel
column4: 200 South Fourth St St. Louis, MO  63102
column13: Great atmosphere for a romantic date night. The view was perfect especially because we made our reservations for right at sunset. I ordered the filet mignon, which was melt in your mouth delicious as were the sides. My boyfriend ordered the St.Louis peppercorn steak and he enjoyed it at first but said it was overpowering after a while of eating it. Parking was very limited though so we could not park at the milennium (the restaurant will validate you for parking if you park in their parking lot) but it was St. Louis on a saturday night, what can you expect?
The staff was first and foremost attentive and professional, but also had a "real" and fun side to them.

Great service, food was ok but way too salty. Makes me wonder if the kitchen is masking or enhancing flavors. Calamari was interesting - thick and chewy. Not what we expected, prefer light and crunchy. Really appreciated the manner in which our server both made us feel comfortable and yet had use feed and paid within a tight theatre timeframe.
Always good and creative cuisine.

It started out with being given menus that were blank, No inserts at all .Our server, Shane then asked us to wait and order after the chef decided on his special for the night. It is now 5:25 p.m. 6:10 comes (no he has not checked onus ONCE) and here came Shane with the manager....announcing someone had dropped one of our dishes and they had to start over, offering a bottle of wine for our inconvenience. My son ordered a rib eye. I have never seen such a pathetic excuse for a steak, it was very thin and mostly fat. Not what you would expect from a fine restaurant.Then came the bill, and they charged us for the complimentary wine. The special evening turned into a disaster!

Beautiful building and great ambiance. The only complaint I would have is that we were squeezed upstairs with a birthday party. They weren't loud but it felt pretty tight. Other than that, the food and service was good. It was also a plus that they had the Cardinal's game playing at the bar, which we had a great view from upstairs.

column1: Vino Nadoz Bistro and Wine Bar
column4: #16 The Boulevard St. Louis St. Louis, MO  63117
column13: Normally one of our favorites, we had a disappointing outing. The squash soup had potential, but was served luke warm at best. The meals were uninspiring. The service was inattentive and we had to constant get the attention of our waiter. May have been a new chef or just a bad Saturday night. We've had at least 3 or 4 fantastic experiences prior.
close to the Fox which is good but food was average. had to ask for a steak knife to cut my spedini and veges

The restaurant was extremely loud. The food was poor and service just adequate. The comment was made regarding slowness of service due to a wedding reception and only three cooks. Obviously, the wedding reception was planned and the management should have been ready for a Saturday night. I would not recommend to others or return.
Fantastic fried chicken on Sundays!!!!
